premises:
All employees who schedule a meeting with their customers will go to the company building today. 
Everyone who has lunch in the company building schedules meetings with their customers. 
Employees have lunch either in the company building or at home.
If an employee has lunch at home, they are working remotely from home.
All employees who are in other countries work remotely from home. 
No managers work remotely from home. 
James will appear in the company today if and only if he is a manager.
conclusion: James does not have lunch in the company.
lean_code:
-- Domain and individuals
axiom Person : Type
axiom James : Person

-- Predicates
axiom Employee : Person → Prop
axiom SchedulesWithCustomers : Person → Prop
axiom GoToCompanyBuildingToday : Person → Prop
axiom LunchInBuilding : Person → Prop
axiom LunchAtHome : Person → Prop
axiom RemoteFromHome : Person → Prop
axiom InOtherCountries : Person → Prop
axiom Manager : Person → Prop
axiom Appear : Person → Prop

-- Premises from the textual context
axiom emp_sched_go :
  ∀ x : Person, Employee x ∧ SchedulesWithCustomers x → GoToCompanyBuildingToday x
axiom lunch_in_building_schedules :
  ∀ x : Person, LunchInBuilding x → SchedulesWithCustomers x
axiom employees_lunch_either :
  ∀ x : Person, Employee x → (LunchInBuilding x ∨ LunchAtHome x)
axiom lunch_at_home_remote :
  ∀ x : Person, Employee x ∧ LunchAtHome x → RemoteFromHome x
axiom employees_abroad_remote :
  ∀ x : Person, Employee x ∧ InOtherCountries x → RemoteFromHome x
axiom managers_not_remote :
  ∀ x : Person, Manager x → ¬ RemoteFromHome x
axiom appear_iff_manager_James :
  Appear James ↔ Manager James

-- Additional facts used in the reasoning
axiom James_is_employee : Employee James
axiom James_not_lunch_in_company : ¬ LunchInBuilding James

-- Goal: James will not appear in the company today
theorem not_appear_James : ¬ Appear James := by
  -- From employees_lunch_either and not lunch in building, deduce lunch at home
  have h_or : LunchInBuilding James ∨ LunchAtHome James :=
    (employees_lunch_either James) James_is_employee
  have h_lunch_home : LunchAtHome James :=
    Or.resolve_left h_or James_not_lunch_in_company
  -- From lunch at home (and employee), deduce remote from home
  have h_remote : RemoteFromHome James :=
    (lunch_at_home_remote James) ⟨James_is_employee, h_lunch_home⟩
  -- From managers_not_remote, deduce James is not a manager
  have h_not_manager : ¬ Manager James := by
    intro hM
    have h_nr : ¬ RemoteFromHome James := (managers_not_remote James) hM
    exact h_nr h_remote
  -- From appear ↔ manager, get appear → manager
  have h_imp : Appear James → Manager James := Iff.mp appear_iff_manager_James
  -- Conclude ¬ Appear James by modus tollens
  intro hA
  exact h_not_manager (h_imp hA)

premises:
Beijing is the capital of the People's Republic of China. 
Beijing is the capital city of the world's most populous nation.
Beijing is located in Northern China.
Beijing hosted the 2008 Summer Olympics and 2008 Summer Paralympics Games.
Beijing has hosted the Summer and Winter Olympics and the Summer and Winter Paralympics.
Many of Beijing's 91 universities consistently rank among the best universities in the world.
conclusion: Beijing is located in southern China.
lean_code:
axiom Place : Type
axiom Beijing : Place

-- Predicates for regional location
axiom Northern : Place → Prop
axiom Southern : Place → Prop

-- Premises from the textual context
axiom P1 : Northern Beijing

-- Rule: Northern and Southern are mutually exclusive
axiom R : ∀ x : Place, Northern x → ¬ Southern x

-- From P1 and R, conclude that Beijing is not in southern China
theorem not_southern_Beijing : ¬ Southern Beijing := by
  exact (R Beijing) P1

premises:
People who are born in a multiple birth with siblings spend a lot of time hanging out with and playing with their siblings.
If people have siblings who were born together, then they were born in a multiple birth.
If people complain often about annoying siblings, then they have siblings who were born together.
If people live at home, then they do not live with strangers.
If people spend a lot of time hanging out with and playing with their siblings, then they often live at home. 
Luke either is a baby born in a multiple birth and live with strangers, or is not a baby born in a multiple birth and does not live with strangers
conclusion: Luke spends a lot of time hanging out and playing with his siblings.
lean_code:
axiom Person : Type
axiom Luke : Person

-- Predicates
axiom MB : Person → Prop          -- born in a multiple birth
axiom Spend : Person → Prop       -- spends a lot of time with siblings
axiom Home  : Person → Prop       -- lives at home
axiom Stranger : Person → Prop    -- lives with strangers

-- Premises
axiom mb_to_spend : ∀ x : Person, MB x → Spend x
axiom spend_to_home  : ∀ x : Person, Spend x → Home x
axiom home_to_not_stranger : ∀ x : Person, Home x → ¬ Stranger x
axiom luke_equiv : (MB Luke ∧ Stranger Luke) ∨ (¬ MB Luke ∧ ¬ Stranger Luke)
axiom spend_Luke : Spend Luke

-- Derived conclusions
theorem luke_not_S : ¬ Stranger Luke := by
  have hH : Home Luke := spend_to_home Luke spend_Luke
  exact home_to_not_stranger Luke hH

theorem luke_not_MB : ¬ MB Luke := by
  have hnotS : ¬ Stranger Luke := luke_not_S
  cases luke_equiv with
  | inl h =>
      -- h : MB Luke ∧ Stranger Luke
      exact False.elim (hnotS h.right)
  | inr h =>
      -- h : ¬ MB Luke ∧ ¬ Stranger Luke
      exact h.left

theorem luke_not_MB_and_not_S : ¬ MB Luke ∧ ¬ Stranger Luke :=
  And.intro luke_not_MB luke_not_S
